data.text:
Welcome to Hattingen, Ennepe-Ruhr district, Germany! This charming destination is a real insider tip for all explorers and nature lovers. The town is located on the southern edge of the Ruhr area and offers idyllic surroundings with many opportunities for hiking, cycling or simply relaxing.

Discover more

One of the most famous sights of Hattingen is the historic old town. Here you can stroll through narrow streets and enjoy the half-timbered houses from different eras. The Old Town Hall and St. George's Church are particularly worth seeing. The Henrichshütte Museum in the nearby district of Westfalen is also worth a visit: there you can learn all about the history of the iron and steel industry in the region.

Cultural highlights can also be discovered in Hattingen: The Theatre on the Volme offers a wide range of programmes from plays to cabaret, while the LWL Open-Air Museum in Hagen provides an insight into life in the countryside in earlier times.

Those who enjoy culinary delights will be delighted by the regional specialities: be sure to try the famous "Rübenkraut" - a spread made from sugar beet syrup - or enjoy hearty home cooking such as beef roulades or kale with Mettwurst.

For outdoor activities, the nearby Baldeneysee is particularly suitable: here you can go sailing, surfing or simply stroll along the shore. Lake Harkort is also a popular destination - there are numerous opportunities for fishing and swimming.

And what to do if the weather doesn't cooperate? Then a visit to the Hattingen leisure pool is a good idea: Here you can swim, take a sauna or whizz down the giant slide.

All in all, Hattingen is definitely worth a trip - whether as a day trip from surrounding towns such as Bochum or Dortmund or as a longer destination for anyone looking for peace and nature. This Travel Guide will help you make the most of your time on site!
